TopicTitle: Is there a transform name that every part is guaranteed to have?

Articles.Content: Is there a transform name that every model is guaranteed to have? (The context is giving arbitrary things ModuleIntake, which require a transform name as a parameter.)

Unfortunately, every model's mesh hierarchy (stock and mod) varies depending on its original application, and it is unlikely there is a universal transform common to all of them.

What you can do is to create in Unity a dummy model containing an Empty transform (named as, say, **rhoark\_intake\_trans**), and then use Module Manager to weld this transform to other models via MODEL{} nodes - MODEL{} nodes will also allow you to specify each component model's position, orientation and scale on a case-by-case basis.
That's something I wouldn't have thought of - thanks.
